message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We utilize the World Bank's Enterprise Survey and Global Financial Development datasets to examine the relationship between access to finance and firm productivity in developing countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Survey", "Global Financial Development datasets"], "topic": ["Financial Sector", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "This article analyzes data from the World Inequality Database to explore the trends and drivers of inequality in Brazil over the past two decades.", "dataset": ["World Inequality Database"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Using the UNICEF Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey and WHO-UNICEF Joint Monitoring Programme dataset, we investigate the impact of sanitation facilities on child nutrition in South Asian countries.", "dataset": ["UNICEF Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey", "WHO-UNICEF Joint Monitoring Programme dataset"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "We employed a mixed method approach using both secondary data sources such as the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey and primary qualitative data collected through focus group discussions to assess the food consumption patterns and dietary habits of children in low-income communities.", "dataset": ["National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Social Sustainability and Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the International Energy Agency and United Nations Development Programme, we estimate the potential economic benefits of renewable energy deployment and climate mitigation policies for developing economies.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency", "United Nations Development Programme"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "This study employs a panel data regression analysis on survey data collected by the Global Entrepreneurship Monitor to investigate the impact of government policies and education on entrepreneurial activities in Latin American countries.", "dataset": ["Global Entrepreneurship Monitor"], "topic": ["Education", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We use a combination of geospatial data from NASA's Landsat program and crowd-sourced land cover classifications from OpenStreetMap to map and analyze the distribution and effects of urbanization in African cities.", "dataset": ["NASA's Landsat program", "OpenStreetMap"], "topic": ["Urban Development", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "In this paper, we compile a novel dataset on infrastructure procurement processes from the World Bank's Private Participation in Infrastructure Database, and analyze the impact of public-private partnerships on project performance and efficiency.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Private Participation in Infrastructure Database"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "We investigate the incidence and determinants of conflict-related violence against women in Sub-Saharan Africa using a combination of survey data from the Demographic and Health Surveys and micro-level data from the Armed Conflict Location and Event Data Project.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys", "Armed Conflict Location and Event Data Project"], "topic": ["Gender", "Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "Using longitudinal data from the China Family Panel Studies and the National Bureau of Statistics, we examine the determinants and patterns of rural-urban migration and its impact on household welfare and regional development in China.", "dataset": ["China Family Panel Studies", "National Bureau of Statistics"], "topic": ["Migration", "Regional Integration"]} ]
